text: In Greek mythology, the Ceryneian Hind (, Elaphos Kerynitis) was a deer sacred to the goddess Artemis. It lived near the town of Ceryneia. It was very big. Its horns were made of gold. Its hooves were made of bronze and/or brass. Herakles was given the task of retrieving it for the third of his famous Twelve Labors. Category:Greek legendary creatures
title: Ceryneian Hind
